translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions, the Tipitaka, the Paṭṭhāna text
The section on the wholesome triad, the arisen triad

original: Kusalo anuppanno dhammo nakusalassa naanuppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kusalaḥ anuppannaḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa na anuppannassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A wholesome, unarisen factor is a condition, as object condition, for a wholesome, unarisen factor. (In brief.)

original: Ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa, adhipatiyā tīṇi, upanissaye aṭṭhārasa. (Uppādī anuppannasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa adhipatiyā tīṇi upanissaye aṭṭhārasa uppādī anuppanna sadisa
translated: In the object, there are eighteen; in the predominance, there are three; in the support, there are eighteen. (Arisen and unarisen are similar.)
